conclusion: The object is placed on a horizontal conveyor belt moving clockwise at a speed of v=6 m/s.
The distance between the two drive wheels M and N is L1=10 m.
The mass of the object is m=3 kg and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ=0.3.
The acceleration due to gravity is g=10 m/s².

premise: The object is moving on a horizontal conveyor belt with a coefficient of kinetic friction μ=0.3.
conclusion: The frictional force acting on the object is Ff = μmg.

premise: Ff = μmg, m=3 kg, g=10 m/s², μ=0.3.
conclusion: The frictional force is Ff = 0.3 × 3 × 10 = 9 N.

premise: The displacement from point M to point N is L1=10 m.
conclusion: The work done by the frictional force is W = F × d.
